com.jrefinery.chart.combination
Class CombinedPlot

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.jrefinery.chart.Plot
        |
        +--com.jrefinery.chart.combination.CombinedPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
AxisChangeListener, AxisConstants, ChartChangeListener, HorizontalValuePlot, VerticalValuePlot
Direct Known Subclasses:
OverlaidPlot
public class CombinedPlot
extends Plot
implements HorizontalValuePlot, VerticalValuePlot

This plot implements a combined plot that can contain one or more CombinedChart objects. Each CombinedChart object is simply a JFreeChart object without title, label, font, background and event handling.

CombinedPlots can display three types of plots: vertically combined, horizontally combined or overlaid. Also nesting of CombinedPlots via CombinedCharts is supported (ex. nesting an overlaid plot inside a vertically combined plot). Depending on the type of CombinedPlot, the horizontal, vertical or both axes will be shared between the sub-plots.

Inner Class Summary
(package private)  class CombinedPlot.ChartInfo
          Internal class to store a chart, plot and it's vertical weight (used only for HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL combined plots).

Field Detail

HORIZONTAL

public static final int HORIZONTAL
Constant used to define a horizontal CombinedPlot. All sub-plots are laid out horizontally one after the other. Each sub-plot should have a different horizontal axis, but the same vertical axis.

VERTICAL

public static final int VERTICAL
Constant used to define a vertical CombinedPlot. All sub-plots are laid out verticaly one on top of the other. Each sub-plot should have a different vertical axis, but the same horizontal axis.

OVERLAID

public static final int OVERLAID
Constant used to define an Overlaid CombinedPlot. All sub-plots are overlaid one on top of the others. Both horizontal and vertical axis should be the same for all sub-plots.

type

private int type
The type of CombinedPlot (HORIZONTAL, VERTICAL, OVERLAID).

charts

protected java.util.List charts
Stores the charts that will be combined together.

weights

protected int weights
Total weights of all charts. Only valid for HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL types.

isAdjusted

protected boolean isAdjusted
Keeps track that we need to call adjustPlots() before drawing charts.

axisRangeSet

protected boolean[] axisRangeSet
Keeps track that we adjusted the range of our axis. This array is indexed by HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL constants.

plotArea

private java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D plotArea
Stores the last plotArea calculated in the draw() method.

inReadjustPlotsMinMax

private boolean inReadjustPlotsMinMax
Flag to prevent StackOverflow while we complete the readjustment.
Constructor Detail

CombinedPlot

public CombinedPlot(Axis axis,
                    int type)
Creates a HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL CombinedPlot.

If type is HORIZONTAL, then axis should contain the shared vertical axis. If type is VERTICAL, then axis should contain the shared horizontal axis.

Parameters:
axis - Shared axis to use for all sub-plots.
type - Type of CombinedPlot (HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL).

CombinedPlot

public CombinedPlot(Axis horizontal,
                    Axis vertical)
Creates an OVERLAID CombinedPlot.
Parameters:
horizontal - Shared horizontal axis to use for all sub-plots.
vertical - Shared vertical axis to use for all sub-plots.
Method Detail

add

public void add(CombinedChart chart)
         throws AxisNotCompatibleException
Adds a CombinedChart to the CombinedPlot. Verifies that the shared axes are the same and assigns a weight of 1 to this chart.
Parameters:
chart - The chart to add
Throws:
AxisNotCompatibleException - If horizontal axis is not the same as previous charts, or if vertical axis is not compatible.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if weight is <= 0 for HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL plots, or weight != 0 for OVERLAID plots.

add

public void add(CombinedChart chart,
                int weight)
         throws AxisNotCompatibleException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Adds a CombinedChart to the CombinedPlot. Verifies that the shared axes are the same.
Parameters:
chart - The chart to add
weight - Weight of this chart relative to the rest. Must be greater than one. For an OVERLAID CombinedPlot, weight must be one.
Throws:
AxisNotCompatibleException - If common axis is not the same as previous charts, or if the other axes is not compatible.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if weight is <= 0 for HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL plots, or weight != 0 for OVERLAID plots.

isCompatibleHorizontalAxis

public boolean isCompatibleHorizontalAxis(Axis axis)
Checks the compatibility of a horizontal axis, returning true if the axis is compatible with the plot, and false otherwise.
Overrides:
isCompatibleHorizontalAxis in class Plot
Parameters:
axis - The horizontal axis.

isCompatibleVerticalAxis

public boolean isCompatibleVerticalAxis(Axis axis)
Checks the compatibility of a vertical axis, returning true if the axis is compatible with the plot, and false otherwise. The vertical axis for this plot must be an instance of VerticalNumberAxis.
Overrides:
isCompatibleVerticalAxis in class Plot
Parameters:
axis - The vertical axis.

getPlotType

public java.lang.String getPlotType()
Returns the plot type as a string. This implementation returns "Overlaid Plot", "Horizontal Combined Plot", "Vertical Combined Plot" or "Unknown Combined Plot" depending of the type of CombinedPlot.
Overrides:
getPlotType in class Plot
Following copied from class: com.jrefinery.chart.Plot
Returns:
A short string describing the plot type.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                 java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D drawArea,
                 DrawInfo info)
Draws the CombinedPlot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a printer). Will perform all the placement calculations for each sub-plots and then tell these to draw themselves.

Overrides:
draw in class Plot
Parameters:
g2 - The graphics device.
drawArea - The area within which the plot (including axis labels) should be drawn.
info - Information about the drawing.

adjustPlots

public void adjustPlots()
Adjusts the charts to combine changing their axis and rescaling them to take into account combined plots. Should be called after adding all sub-charts to the CombinedPlot.

readjustPlotsMinMax

private void readjustPlotsMinMax(boolean doHorizontalAxis,
                                 boolean doVerticalAxis)
Readjust the plot axes min and max as needed. After readjusting the plot axes, it will readjust recursively contained combined plots that were missed.
Parameters:
doHorizontalAxis - Hint that we need to adjust the horizontal axis. In order to adjust the axis, in addition to the hint being true, the axisRangeSet[HORIZONTAL] flag for this plot must be true indicating that the plot does indeed adjust it's horizontal axis.
doVerticalAxis - Hint that we need to adjust the vertical axis. In order to adjust the axis, in addition to the hint being true, the axisRangeSet[VERTICAL] flag for this plot must be true indicating that the plot does indeed adjust it's vertical axis.

adjustPlotsAxis

protected void adjustPlotsAxis()
Adjusts the internal charts to allow automatic rendering of their conponents. This includes setting all HorizontalAxis to a CombinedHorizontalXXXXAxis or OverlaidHorizontalXXXXAxis, and setting all VerticalAxis to a CombinedVerticalXXXXAxis or OverlaidVerticalXXXXAxis.

adjustPlotsAxis

protected void adjustPlotsAxis(boolean hVisible,
                               boolean vVisible)
Adjusts the internal charts to allow automatic rendering of their conponents. This includes setting all HorizontalAxis to a CombinedHorizontalXXXXAxis or OverlaidHorizontalXXXXAxis, and setting all VerticalAxis to a CombinedVerticalXXXXAxis or OverlaidVerticalXXXXAxis.
Parameters:
hVisible - Indicates if the horizontal axis is visible for this plot

horizontalAxisVisible

protected boolean horizontalAxisVisible(boolean firstPlot,
                                        boolean lastPlot,
                                        Plot plot)
Returns true if a horizontal axis is visible. Sub-classes can overwrite this method to implement additional logic. This implementation returns true for HORIZONTAL plots or if the plot under analysis is the first of the combination.
Parameters:
firstPlot - Are we the first plot of the CombinedPlot?
lastPlot - Are we the last plot of the CombinedPlot?
plot - The plot.

verticalAxisVisible

protected boolean verticalAxisVisible(boolean firstPlot,
                                      boolean lastPlot,
                                      Plot subPlot)
Returns true is a vertical axis is visible. Sub-classes can overwrite this method to implement additional logic. This implementation returns true for VERTICAL plots or if the plot under analysis is the first of the combination.
Parameters:
firstPlot - Are we the first plot of the CombinedPlot?
lastPlot - Are we the last plot of the CombinedPlot?
subPlot - Plot under analysis.

                             boolean flag)

adjustSeriesPaintAndStroke

private void adjustSeriesPaintAndStroke()
Adjusts the Stroke and Paint objects associated with each Plot's Series that use the CombinedDataset so that each series is always drawn using the same rendering objects, no matter on what plot it appears.

                                        Dataset masterData)
Adjusts the Stroke and Paint objects associated with each Plot's Series that use the CombinedDataset so that each series is always drawn using the same rendering objects, no matter on what plot it appears.
Parameters:
masterPlot - Outermost plot that defines all the Stroke and Paint object to use
masterData - Dataset

                           throws AxisNotCompatibleException
